response.message: This was an awesome idea guys. Thank you for this.
Cant agree more with this post Joel. RIP Steve. Thank you Steve for showing us the way.

Very well said. When it comes to the computers and devices we interact with on a daily basis, very few people have had the impact that Steve had. Many of the innovative products that Apple has sold over the years would probably not exist without him.

Thank you, Joel, for this beautiful post about Steve, and thank you Steve, for everything you gave us. Another star shines in the heavens. May we all aspire to the legacy he showed us while he was alive, and that we are left with.

Now, whoever's been cutting onions tonight, you can stop.
Sad day.

He will be missed for a long time to come. He might have left this world, but his legacy will drive the future.

"His memory will be a blessing."

Thanks Joel, well said.
Steve and you have been an inspiration to me.
Nice words Joel. He wanted to put a ding in the universe. And he did it... "His memory will be a blessing".
“I’m convinced that the only thing that kept me going was that I loved what I did.”
RIP steve.
He has many things in the pipeline that have yet to be realized.  I suspect he'll be around for a while longer.
Well said.
RIP Steve Jobs, his tremendous contribution to technology will never be forgotten.

What he did for UI design is phenomenal. At 8 months of age my son could unlock an iPhone in one foul swoop while you weren't looking and delete all your apps, and now at 16 months, he can't say more than 5 words, but can facetime me when he wants to see me, play his favourite find-the-animal game, play The Wiggles non stop (and re-start it when they run out) and watch Bob the Builder on the TV Catchup app on our iPad.

That's a lasting testament to mankind.
Steve was the user's advocate.  Others built feature lists and bolted on a GUI as an afterthought.  For Steve, the user's experience was the origin.  Everything else sprang up organically.

Nice gesture by Joel and the SO team. 
RIP Steve.
Absolutely. This was the first time someone famous had died, and I was actually sad. Steve Jobs was such a great innovator. RIP man.
Beautifully written Joel.
Best Post i have read today. Good one Joel
That's a lovely tribute.

By this logic, you ought to put the system message on the User Experience site too.

Apple showed everyone what good UX looked like.

Great post. Shows the importance of not losing sight of your goals and vision.

RIP Steve.
Great post, and great that you put a message up. But why didn't you make it network wide message, he was an amazing guy and as many people as possible should know about him.

Thanks for this post! I am really inspired by it. "This changes the world because ANYONE can do it. Not just nerds. So everyone does." 
I will always remember it.
Well said, sir!
His unique style of marketing speeches when Apple is going to unveil a new exciting product(s) will always be remembered. I admire him for that. Rest in Peace Steve :-(
R.I.P Jobs! You've changed the world and now you can change the heaven!
Excellent tribute, Joel. The world is a better place because of him, and you captured that succinctly and beautifully. R.I.P. Steve.
Hope you can do the same for Dennis Ritchie.
This is a very nice tribute. We owe you a lot Steve.

The mainstream media had played a lot on the Steve's brash,nerdy character and the often unfair business dealings Apple, so I was never interested in reading about him. But after his death, reading this tribute, other articles and starting on Isaacson's book, I feel very sad that an extraordinary man has departed so soon.
Touching tribute Joel.
